title: Predicate (mathematical logic)
summary: In logic, a predicate is a symbol which represents a property or a relation. For instance, the first order formula P ( a ) {\displaystyle P(a)} , the symbol P {\displaystyle P} is a predicate which applies to the individual constant a {\displaystyle a} . Similarly, in the formula R ( a , b ) {\displaystyle R(a,b)} the predicate R {\displaystyle R} is a predicate which applies to the individual constants a {\displaystyle a} and b {\displaystyle b} .
